docs.lead_paragraph: The Zika virus may be particularly adept at entrenching itself in parts of the body that are shielded from the immune system, making it harder to fight off and possibly lengthening the timeframe in which it can be transmitted, top U.S. experts said on Friday.

headline.main: Zika Virus May Hide in Organs Protected From the Immune System
headline.print_headline: Zika Virus May Hide in Organs Protected From the Immune System

docs.snippet: The Zika virus may be particularly adept at entrenching itself in parts of the body that are shielded from the immune system, making it harder to fight off and possibly lengthening the timeframe in which it can be transmitted, top U.S. experts said...

docs.lead_paragraph: Global health officials have said that the Zika virus, which has been linked to severe birth defects in thousands of babies in Brazil, is rapidly spreading in the Americas and could infect up to 4 million people.

headline.main: Factbox: Why the Zika Virus Is Causing Alarm
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Why the Zika Virus Is Causing Alarm

docs.snippet: Global health officials have said that the Zika virus, which has been linked to severe birth defects in thousands of babies in Brazil, is rapidly spreading in the Americas and could infect up to 4 million people.

headline.main: ‘Both the Democrats and Republicans Want Radical Change’:  Readers on the New Hampshire Primary

docs.abstract: Readers dissected the influence of gender, generation and political agenda on the primary, in response to recent columns and editorials.
docs.snippet: Readers dissected the influence of gender, generation and political agenda on the primary, in response to recent columns and editorials.

docs.lead_paragraph: Women who are pregnant should consider putting off travel to areas infected with the Zika virus as a precautionary measure, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Friday in new advice.

headline.main: Pregnant Women Should Consider Delaying Travel to Zika Areas-WHO
headline.print_headline: Pregnant Women Should Consider Delaying Travel to Zika Areas-WHO

docs.lead_paragraph: In the big leagues of fashion, there is only one designer who has consistently challenged the paradox of power and sex — and she’s done it with a laugh, a cigarette and a billion-dollar business.

headline.main: The Forceful Brilliance of Donatella Versace

headline.main: Tylenol During Pregnancy Tied to Asthma in Children

docs.abstract: Taking Tylenol (acetaminophen) during pregnancy is associated with a slight increase in the risk for asthma in offspring, a new study has found.
docs.snippet: Taking Tylenol (acetaminophen) during pregnancy is associated with a slight increase in the risk for asthma in offspring, a new study has found.

docs.lead_paragraph: The government is shipping Zika virus tests for pregnant women to health departments around the country, but warning there could be temporary shortages, as travelers try to tell if they returned with an infection that could put a developing baby at risk.

headline.main: CDC Ships Zika Test for Pregnant Women; Puerto Rico at Risk

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Olympic Committee (USOC) is to recruit two infectious disease experts to advise potential members of their Rio 2016 Games team who are concerned about the Zika virus outbreak in Brazil.

headline.main: U.S. to Hire Disease Experts Ahead of Rio Games
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Hire Disease Experts Ahead of Rio Games

docs.lead_paragraph: Essential information for areas like the Caribbean and Hawaii affected by Zika or dengue, from the use of mosquito repellent to refunds on airfare and hotels.

headline.main: What Travelers Need to Know About Zika and Dengue

docs.lead_paragraph: Crisis pregnancy centers in California are in a battle with the state over a new law requiring them to post a notice that free or low-cost abortion care is available.

headline.main: Pregnancy Clinics Fight for Right to Deny Abortion Information
headline.print_headline: Pregnancy Clinics Fight for Right to Deny Abortion Information

docs.abstract: Crisis pregnancy centers in California are engaged in legal battle with state over law requiring them to post notice stating that free or low-cost abortion, contraception and prenatal care are provided to low-income women through public programs; clinics are run by those who oppose abortion on religious grounds, and they argue that law violates their First Amendment right to free speech.
docs.snippet: Crisis pregnancy centers in California are in a battle with the state over a new law requiring them to post a notice that free or low-cost abortion care is available.
